meanings.sent1: She kept mislabelling the jars in the pantry.
meanings.sent2: The teacher realized she was mislabelling the students' assignments.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was mislabelling all the presents in Santa's workshop.
meanings.sent4: The detective knew the criminal was mislabelling the evidence to throw off the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The chef's assistant was constantly mislabelling the ingredients, causing chaos in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: The act of labeling something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The mislabelling of the products led to confusion among the customers.
meanings.sent2: He discovered the mislabelling of the boxes in the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors began with the mislabelling of the actors in the play.
meanings.sent4: The mislabelling of the map made the travelers take the wrong path.
meanings.sent5: The mislabelling of the files caused delays in the project completion.
